citations.narrative:
The licensee has not notified Animal Care 90 days prior to a change in address. An inspection was attempted on April 25,
2023. The inspector knocked on the door, honked their horn, and called the phone number. The phone number was
disconnected and there was no way to leave a message. There were no animals seen or heard, the inside of all windows
was covered, and there was Tyvek sheeting covering several doors and the siding and, to the inspector, gave the
appearance that no one was currently living at the location. The inspector asked a neighbor if the property in question
had been correctly identified as the licensee's property. The neighbor reported to the inspector that the licensee had
moved out of state approximately one month ago. Licensees shall notify Animal Care no fewer than 90 days prior to a
change in the business address. Failure to notify APHIS in advance of a change in address prevents Officials from
ensuring adherence to the AWA Standards. The licensee must correct this by applying for and obtaining a new license,
with the new address listed, prior to conducting any regulated activity. Correct by: April 28, 2023.

citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
A responsible adult was not available to accompany APHIS Officials during the inspection process at 5:00 pm on April 25,
2023. The facility was called prior to arrival and the phone number was stated to no longer be in service. Once at the
facility, the inspector knocked on the door and beeped the horn. Contact was not made with any facility representative.
End Section

narrative:
2.1(b)(1) 
   
Requirements and application 
The licensee has not notified Animal Care 90 days prior to a change in address. An inspection was attempted on April 25, 
2023. The inspector knocked on the door, honked their horn, and called the phone number.  The phone number was 
disconnected and there was no way to leave a message. There were no animals seen or heard, the inside of all windows 
was covered, and there was Tyvek sheeting covering several doors and the siding and, to the inspector, gave the 
appearance that no one was currently living at the location.  The inspector asked a neighbor if the property in question 
had been correctly identified as the licensee's property. The neighbor reported to the inspector that the licensee had 
moved out of state approximately one month ago. Licensees shall notify Animal Care no fewer than 90 days prior to a 
change in the business address. Failure to notify APHIS in advance of a change in address prevents Officials from 
ensuring adherence to the AWA Standards. The licensee must correct this by applying for and obtaining a new license, 
with the new address listed, prior to conducting any regulated activity. Correct by: April 28, 2023. 
2.126(b) 
   
Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.

A responsible adult was not available to accompany APHIS Officials during the inspection process at 5:00 pm on April 25, 
2023. The facility was called prior to arrival and the phone number was stated to no longer be in service. Once at the 
facility, the inspector knocked on the door and beeped the horn. Contact was not made with any facility representative. 
 
 
 
End Section
